Signal.Name: MemBuffCache
Signal.Description: Memory in buffers and cache [KiB] (only relevant if Linux).
This should be set to 1 when you want Application statemachine to go from PreOperational to Running (for example; I/O Servers have correct NumberOfNodesOnline, etc)
Signal.Name: SafeToStart

Signal.Description: This is set to 1 when the the following conditions are true: The subsystem is up, StartupFlagsState == StartupWaitFlags, and SafeToStart is 1.
Signal.Name: BootupDone

Alarm.Name: Disk Alarm
Alarm.Description: This alarm is set when something is wrong with the disk or files on the disk.

Alarm.Name: InvalidLicense
Alarm.Text: Invalid or missing feature license detected.

Alarm.Description: Alarm is triggered (with Text containing the list of errors) when some node of the component (like operator) has configuration fault.
Alarm.Name: ConfigurationFaults

Alarm.Description: Configuration save period timed out. The configuration saving has been forcibly enabled, even though DelayConfigurationSave is true. Consider increasing MaxConfigurationSaveDelay.
Alarm.Name: DelayConfigurationSaveAborted
Alarm.Text: Configuration file write was re-enabled (DelayConfigurationSave overridden)

Alarm.Name: UnhandledExceptionDetected
Alarm.Text: No unhandled C++ exceptions have been detected

Alarm.Description: This alarm is set when controller clock is not monotonic (steady). The alarm can indicate that PTP time-sync is not configured or working properly or not running on PTP-supported hardware.
Alarm.Name: NonMonotonicClockDetected
Alarm.Text: Non-monotonic clock detected. Steady processes scheduling is not possible.

Alarm.Description: This alarm is set when StartupChecks==1 and the application times out waiting for the conditions it requires to go to Running state.
Alarm.Name: StartupOverrideAlarm
Alarm.Text: Application startup overridden due to timeout or internal checks being skipped.

Parameter.Description: The maximum amount of time that DelayConfigurationSave can block the configuration saving. If DelayConfigurationSave is active for longer than this time, configuration saving will be allowed again, and the DelayConfigurationSaveAborted alarm will trigger.
Parameter.Name: MaxConfigurationSaveDelay

Parameter.Description: If application is not in Running state within this timeout, it overrides the startup-wait sequence and forces the Application to Running state. See also 'SafeToStart' and 'StartupChecks'.
Parameter.Name: StartupOverrideTime
